Manhattanville-West Harlem has the second lowest tree count in Manhattan

When accounting for the area of the 29 Manhattan neighborhoods, Manhattanville has the seventh lowest tree density.

Tree coverage, or greenspace, relates to heat vulnerability–a resident’s relative risk of dying during and immediately following extreme heat.

Manhattanville and Hamilton Heights have heat vulnerability index values of 3, indicating medium risk.

Total 2015 Street Tree Count

1-1000

1001-2000

2001-3000

3001-4000

4001-5000

5001-6000

NA

Community Board 9

Hamilton Heights-Sugar Hill

Manhattanville-West Harlem

Morningside Heights

Heat Vulnerability Index

1

2

3

4

5

NA

Note: Street trees do not include public parks and other green spaces. Heat vulnerability includes greenspace in addition to social factors such as air conditioning access and median income. Source: NYC Open Data, NYC 2015 Street Tree Census.

Graphic by Ana Pekec
